"step_by_step_thinking": "After reviewing the provided documents, I did not find any information about pulp obliteration or dentinogenesis imperfecta. Therefore, I will look for relevant information on pulp obliteration and dentinogenesis imperfecta from external sources.

Dentinogenesis imperfecta is a genetic disorder that affects the development of dentin, which is the layer beneath tooth enamel. It can cause opacity, brittleness, and discoloration of teeth. Type I, II, and III refer to different severity levels of the condition.

Complete obliteration of pulp is not typically seen in any type of dentinogenesis imperfecta. Dentin dysplasia is another genetic disorder that affects dentin development, but it does not specifically cause pulp obliteration either.

Based on my understanding of these conditions, I conclude that complete obliteration of pulp is not a characteristic feature of any type of dentinogenesis imperfecta.",
